content.rendered:
I was reading that a local pastor had decided to back a local semi-pro team until he discovered that they were going to sell beer at the events. It must have been a touch decision. But the pastor stuck by his decision and that is commendable.

It can be hard to stick by our decisions, especially if someone we care about is trying to get us to change our mind. I remember someone trying to get me to smoke for the first time. It wasn’t a hard decision to choose not to smoke, but what if it had been a close friend. The choice would have been much harder.

Look at Samson and the choice that he had with Delilah. That must have been tough. In fact, Samson compared Delilah and her nagging to a constant dripping.

The problem is that, if we give in in are of our lives, it can be easier to compromise in other areas. One thing can lead to another and another. Before we know it we are doing things that we never intended to do.

It’s best if we can to know our boundaries and stop there. If we can, we may need to move our boundaries to in so that we are better equipped to avoid the things that we should. And, if you can, let others know where your boundaries stand. It will help you and it will help them know how to relate better to you.
